result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 108 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Current revocation sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Not to use or possess the personal or financial information of any other person. No to have any checking or credit card accounts without the agent's approval. Inform agent of all prescriptions. 
  Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael A Turner in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes. 
Victim A appeared by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 Years & 8 Months.
Initial Confinement:  20 Months.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
108 Days Credit.
Concurrent to: Current Revocation Sentence.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Not to use or possess the personal or financial information of any other person.
Not to have any checking or credit card accounts without the agent's approval.
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed;
Inform Agent of all prescriptions;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided;
 
Fine:  $268
DRGOD:  $10
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.
